subject: Technology
title: YouTube: Broadcast Yourself
description: Learn YouTube: Broadcast Yourself in one minute.

hook.text: Three former PayPal employees couldn't find a video of the 2004 tsunami online. So they built a site to share videos.

buildup.text: YouTube launched in 2005. Within a year, 100 million videos were being watched every day.

discovery.text: Google bought YouTube for $1.65 billion in 2006. Many called it an absurd overpayment. It was a bargain.

twist.text: YouTube didn't just host videos. It created entirely new careers. People became millionaires filming from their bedrooms.

climax.text: YouTube is the world's second-largest search engine. It transformed entertainment, education, and how we consume media.

punchline.text: A missing tsunami video created the world's biggest stage.

quiz.question: How much did Google pay for YouTube in 2006?
